conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the forces acting on the cargo as it moves along the conveyor using given information.
Figure C depicts a conveyor with length L1 = 6 m and speed v0 = 2 m/s moving clockwise; cargo is released from rest at the left end.
Figure D is not relevant to the problem.
Cargo is initially at rest on the conveyor moving at speed v0 = 2 m/s.
Cargo experiences a frictional force Ff = μ1 N, where μ1 = 0.2 is the kinetic friction coefficient, and N is the normal force.
Since the conveyor is moving horizontally, the normal force N = mg, where m is the mass of the cargo and g = 10 m/s².
Frictional force Ff = μ1 mg = 0.2 × m × 10 = 2m.
Net force acting on the cargo is Fnet = Ff - m dv0/dt = 2m - m dv0/dt.
Acceleration a of the cargo is given by a = Fnet/m = (2m - m dv0/dt)/m = 2 - dv0/dt.
Time t taken for the cargo to travel from the left end to the right end is t = L1/v0 = 6/2 = 3 s.
The acceleration of the cargo is 0 m/s², and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end is 3 seconds.
